block.p: The top 10 candidates for the 133rd Kentucky Derby on May 5 at Churchill Downs in Louisville. Horses are listed in order of preference.
By JOE DRAPE
HORSE: 1. Nobiz Like Shobiz TRAINER: Barclay Tagg JOCKEY: Cornelio Velasquez Victory in the Wood Memorial makes him the Derby favorite.
HORSE: 2. Street Sense TRAINER: Carl Nafzger JOCKEY: Calvin Borel Lost Blue Grass by a nose, but it hardly took anything out of him.
HORSE: 3. Scat Daddy TRAINER: Todd Pletcher JOCKEY: John Velazquez Hard to argue with the Florida Derby champ. He wins.
HORSE: 4. Curlin TRAINER: Steve Asmussen JOCKEY: Robby Albarado He won the Arkansas Derby by a record 101/2 lengths and is undefeated in three starts.
HORSE: 5. Circular Quay TRAINER: Todd Pletcher JOCKEY: Garrett Gomez Louisiana Derby winner goes to the Derby off an eight-week rest, which is dicey.
HORSE: 6. Cowtown Cat TRAINER: Todd Pletcher JOCKEY: Fernando Jara
Illinois Derby winner is certainly improving.
HORSE: 7. Dominican TRAINER: Darrin Miller JOCKEY: Rafael Bejarano
Blue Grass Stakes upsetter has quick stretch kick -- at least on synthetic surfaces.
HORSE: 8. Any Given Saturday TRAINER: Todd Pletcher JOCKEY: John Velazquez Street Sense and Nobiz have defeated him in the last pair.
HORSE: 9. Tiago TRAINER: John Shirreffs JOCKEY: Mike Smith Late run in Santa Anita Derby victory earned him a trip to Churchill Downs.
HORSE: 10. Hard Spun TRAINER: Larry Jones JOCKEY: Mario Pino The colt has won 5 of 6, but against whom?

HORSE RACING
